trans-unit.source: Represents a date in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
A CalendarDay object represents a date in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.

You can use this class in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.DayRender> event handler to programmatically access the properties of a date as it is rendered on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.

This allows you to determine the properties of the day (such as whether the date is selectable, selected, today's date, or a weekend date) and programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of CalendarDay, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay> class.
> [!NOTE] > Although this constructor is available, an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay> class is not typically created dynamically.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay>.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |Date|The value of the `date` parameter.| |DayNumberText|The value of the `dayNumberText` parameter.| |IsOtherMonth|The value of the `isOtherMonth` parameter.| |IsSelected|The value of the `isSelected` parameter.| |IsToday|The value of the `isToday` parameter.| |IsWeekend|The value of the `isWeekEnd` parameter.|
A <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> object that contains the date represented by an instance of this class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the date represented by an instance of this class is either a Saturday or a Sunday; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the date represented by an instance of this class is the current date; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the date represented by an instance of this class is selected on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the date represented by an instance of this class is in a month other than the displayed month on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The day number for the date represented by this class.
Gets the date represented by an instance of this class.
This property is read-only.
Use the Date property to programmatically determine the date represented by an instance of this class.
A <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> object that contains the date represented by an instance of this class.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.
Gets the string equivalent of the day number for the date represented by an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay"></xref> class.
This property is read-only.
Use the DayNumberText property to determine the string equivalent of the day number for the date represented by an instance of this class.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.
The string equivalent of the day number for the date represented by an instance of this class.

Gets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class is in a month other than the month displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
This property is read-only.

Use the IsOtherMonth property to programmatically determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class is in a month other than the month displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day based on this value.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the date represented by an instance of this class is in a month other than the month displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class can be selected in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
Use the IsSelectable property to specify or determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class can be selected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance behavior of the day, based on this value.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the date can be selected; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class is selected in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
This property is read-only.
Use the IsSelected property to programmatically determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class is selected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the date represented by an instance of this class is selected in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class is the same date specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.TodaysDate*> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
This property is read-only.

Use the IsToday property to programmatically determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class is the same date specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.TodaysDate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.
> [!NOTE] > Although the date specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.TodaysDate%2A> property is usually the system date on the server, it is possible to change it, if necessary.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the date represented by an instance of this class is the same date specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.TodaysDate*> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class is a either Saturday or Sunday.
This property is read-only.
Use the IsWeekend property to programmatically determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class is either a Saturday or a Sunday.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the date represented by an instance of this class is either a Saturday or a Sunday; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
